org.xchain.framework.jxpath

Interface ScopedQNameVariables

  • All Superinterfaces:
    QNameVariables, java.io.Serializable, org.apache.commons.jxpath.Variables
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ScopedQNameVariablesImpl

    public interface ScopedQNameVariables
extends QNameVariables
    An extension of the QNameVariables to work within a given scope.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Devon Tackett

    • Method Detail

      • declareVariable

        void declareVariable(java.lang.String varName,
                   java.lang.Object value,
                   Scope scope)
        Declares a variable for the specified name and value. If the variable name is of the form 'prefix:local-name', then the prefix is resolved. If the variable name is of the form '{uri}local-name', then the uri is taken from the variable name. Otherwise, the entire variable name is considered a local name and the uri is the null namespace uri.
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the variable with the format 'prefix:local-name', '{uri}local-name', or 'local-name'.
        value - The value to be set for this variable.
        scope - The scope of the variable.

      • declareVariable

        void declareVariable(javax.xml.namespace.QName varName,
                   java.lang.Object value,
                   Scope scope)
        Declares a variable for the specified QName and value.
        Parameters:
        varName - The QName of the variable .
        value - The value to be set for this variable.
        scope - The scope of the variable.

      • getVariable

        java.lang.Object getVariable(java.lang.String varName,
                           Scope scope)
        Get the variable value at the given name for the given scope.
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the variable.
        scope - The scope of the variable.
        Returns:
        The variable for the given name at the given scope. Null if the variable does not exist.

      • getVariable

        java.lang.Object getVariable(javax.xml.namespace.QName varName,
                           Scope scope)
        Get the variable value at the given QName for the given scope.
        Parameters:
        varName - The QName of the variable.
        scope - The scope of the variable.
        Returns:
        The variable for the given QName at the given scope. Null if the variable does not exist.

      • isDeclaredVariable

        boolean isDeclaredVariable(javax.xml.namespace.QName varName,
                         Scope scope)
        Determine if the variable with the given QName exists at the given scope.
        Parameters:
        varName - The QName of the variable.
        scope - The scope to check at.
        Returns:
        True if the variable is declared at the given scope. False if not.

      • undeclareVariable

        void undeclareVariable(java.lang.String varName,
                     Scope scope)
        Remove the declaration of the variable with the given name at the given scope.
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the variable to undeclare.
        scope - The scope at which to undeclare the variable.
